gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server
Class FerretAnalysisModule

java.lang.Object
  org.iges.anagram.AbstractModule
      gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server.FerretAnalysisModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Module
public class FerretAnalysisModule
extends AbstractModule

This module runs a Ferret analysis task and returns a handle to the results.

A Ferret analysis task is issued using a URL with "_expr_": /dirs/_expr_{datasetNames}{expressions}[{bounds}]

This Ferret analysis expression can be seen as a temporary dataset generated by FDS server. A OpenDAP query can be imposed on this temporary dataset, such as DDS, DAS, DODS, INFO or ASCII query. There are 2 or 3 clauses in a Ferret analysis task URL, separated by curly brackets. The first and second clauses are required, but the third clause is optional. The first datasetNames specify those dataset names that will be used to generate the temporary dataset. datasetNames can be local datasets, remote DODS datasets or another Ferret analysis task sent to the same server. All the specified dataset names should be comma-separated.

expressions can be any Ferret commands to generate the temporary dataset. The expression should be semi-comma separated. If a variable is defined without using Ferret commands, the variable will be used as a variable in the resultant dataset.

bounds is optional. It specifies the subset requested. It can be expressed in two ways:

  • If it starts with "i:", then it specifies the subset by indices.

  • Otherwise, it specifies the subset in the world coordinates.

Class org.iges.grads.server.GradsAnalysisModule is used as a reference when writing this class

Method Detail

getModuleID

public java.lang.String getModuleID()
Description copied from interface: Module
Returns an ID for this module. This ID should be a legal XML tag name. It has two uses: as a tag name in the server's configuration file, and as the final element of the complete module name.

Specified by:
getModuleID in interface Module
Specified by:
getModuleID in class AbstractModule

configure

public void configure(Setting setting)
Description copied from class: AbstractModule
Configures the module according to the settings provided. The server supports dynamic reconfiguration. Thus this method may be called at any time in the life of the module. If the module cannot be reconfigured, it should throw an exception.

Specified by:
configure in interface Module
Specified by:
configure in class AbstractModule
Parameters:
setting - The settings to be used in configuring the module.

doAnalysis

public TempDataHandle doAnalysis(java.lang.String handleName,
                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                 Privilege privilege)
                          throws ModuleException
Parses the input String handleName and generate a temporary dataset using Ferret server.

The temporary dataset is returned as a TempDataHandle

Parameters:
handleName - the name of handle for the generated temporary dataset. It should have at least a substring "_expr_".
request - the HttpServletRequest instance that represents the current request
privilege - the privilege associated with the current request.
Returns:
a TempDataHandle class representing the temporary dataset generated by the analysis expression
Throws:
ModuleException - if anything goes wrong during the analysis

                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                             java.io.File jnlFile,
                             Privilege privilege)
                      throws ModuleException
Creates a temporary journal file for Ferret to run.

Parameters:
parsed - a FerretAnalysisModule.ParsedExpression instance for input analysis expression
request - the HttpServletRequest instance that represents the current request
jnlFile - the returned jounal file
privilege - the privilige associated with this analysis task
Throws:
ModuleException - if something wrong during the jounal file creation

                             Privilege privilege)
